intro: Bupleurum junceum f. multiflorum, commonly known as the multifloral bupleurum, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate floral display.
